title: Machine Learning-Based Modeling Workshop for Public Debt Prediction

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistical analysis, understanding of economic indicators, and basic programming experience
context.additional_context: Learners participate in predictive modeling projects using real economic data to enhance public policy understanding. Hands-on learning with Python and machine learning tools (Random Forest) via digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operational principles of the Random Forest algorithm for public debt forecasting.
Learners can preprocess real economic data and build predictive models referencing Italian case studies.
Learners can evaluate predictive accuracy through model validation processes and compile results into policy proposals.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
